definitions.definition: A division, a portion, a share.
definitions.example: We gave three deals of grain in tribute to the king.

definitions.definition: (often followed by of) An indefinite quantity or amount; a lot (now usually qualified by great or good).
An act of dealing or sharing out.
The distribution of cards to players; a player's turn for this.
A particular instance of buying or selling; a transaction
definitions.example: We need to finalise the deal with Henderson by midnight.

definitions.definition: Specifically, a transaction offered which is financially beneficial; a bargain.
An agreement between parties; an arrangement
definitions.example: He made a deal with the devil.

definitions.definition: A situation, occasion, or event.
A thing, an unspecified or unidentified object.
definitions.example: The deal with four tines is called a pitchfork.

definitions.definition: To distribute among a number of recipients, to give out as one’s portion or share.
definitions.example: The fighting is over; now we deal out the spoils of victory.

definitions.definition: To administer or give out, as in small portions.
To distribute cards to the players in a game.
To pitch.
definitions.example: The whole crowd waited for him to deal a real humdinger.

definitions.definition: To have dealings or business.
To conduct oneself, to behave.
To take action; to act.
To trade professionally (followed by in).
To sell, especially to sell illicit drugs.
definitions.example: This club takes a dim view of members who deal drugs.

definitions.definition: To be concerned with.
To handle, to manage, to cope.
Wood that is easy to saw (from conifers such as pine or fir).
A plank of softwood (fir or pine board).
A wooden board or plank, usually between 12 or 14 feet in length, traded as a commodity in shipbuilding.
Made of deal.
